sourceMeaningMnemonic: Your <radical>mouth</radical> has the <radical>power</radical> to <kanji>add</kanji> words together to form a sentence. Marvel at the massive and mighty power your mouth holds! You add words together in an amazing fashion!
meaningInfo: Say this sentence out loud. Incredible! You’ve used the power of your mouth to add words together in a sentence. Your parents must be very proud of you.
readingMnemonic: Your parents are so proud of you for using your powerful mouth to <kanji>add</kanji> words together that they decide to surprise you with a gift. It’s a new <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). It’s that shiny brand new car that you’d always wanted. You’re speechless. However, your speechlessness frustrates your parents so they decide to take away the car they just gave you. Boo hoo.
readingInfo: Imagine how awful it would be to have a new car given to you only to have it taken away immediately after. Feel this rollercoaster of emotion as you are joyful and excited, then sad and sorrowful.
